history.content:
If you have to choose, I would say that 170/188/189 is more related to what you are interested in.

CS 61C is the intro to Computer Architecture and Systems, and is (in my opinion) an amazing class. It's not about machine learning or stats at all, but it would definitely be useful if you want a "solid computer science background". It would provide valuable breadth if you are already familiar with the stats/machine learning side of CS.

-----------------------------

Take CS 61C. In my opinion, 61C is what separates Berkeley computer science majors from all other tech sector people. (61A and 61B separate computer science majors in general from other tech people.) You will thoroughly understand how the machine works, and what you don't understand, you will know where to find it.


Why is this useful? If you ever want to write your own high performance ML library, you need to understand parallelism, SIMD, multithreading, GPU programming, etc. - optimizations to make your library fast. Or if you want to build custom ML hardware - look up Google's TPU (Tensorflow Processing Unit). It's a chip designed for fast tensorflow processing at the warehouse scale. Any 61C student can read an article on the TPU and understand what it's saying.

If you have to choose, I would say that 170/188/189 is more related to what you are interested in.

CS 61C is the intro to Computer Architecture and Systems, and is (in my opinion) an amazing class. It's not about machine learning or stats at all, but it would definitely be useful if you want a "solid computer science background". It would provide valuable breadth if you are already familiar with the stats/machine learning side of CS.

children.subject: I am assuming that you have not take cs70 yet since you are taking math 55. but cs70 is a prerequisite to 170
While it might be doable to do CS 170 after Math 55 instead of CS 70, doing it concurrently seems like a bad idea (and might not even be allowed).
It's allowed, but a bad idea unless you have a good background with proofs.

Thanks for the responses. I would take 170 for sure, but I am considering if I should take it along side with 61C given its workload is pretty heavy. Do you think taking CS170 and 61C (and Math 55) together is manageable?

history.content: I am stat major interested in doing machine learning so I definitely want to have some solid computer science background. I heard CS 170, which I will take, is a fundamental class for CS students, but 61C, on the other hand, is not that useful. Should I still take 61C or should I consider taking a more interesting/useful upper div, say CS188/189, although I have already taken machine learning from the Stat department.
history.subject: Is 61C worth taking?
